meanings.definition: Make minor changes in (a text) in order to make it fairer, more accurate, or more up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: She is amending her essay to fix any errors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is amending the student's paper for clarity.
meanings.sent3: He kept amending his story to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: Like a tailor amending a dress, she refined her writing.
meanings.sent5: With each amending, the document became more polished.

meanings.definition: Make minor changes in (a law or legal document) in order to improve it or correct a mistake.
meanings.sent1: The government is amending the constitution to protect citizens' rights.
meanings.sent2: Lawyers are amending the contract to avoid any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The judge jokingly said he would be amending the law of gravity next.
meanings.sent4: The amendments were like amending a broken bridge, fixing the gaps.
meanings.sent5: The process of amending laws ensures a fair and just society.
